name: Kids meal planner
description: Get some inspiration for your kids meals with a weekly meal planner that offers suggestions based on your preferences and what's in your pantry and gives you recipes and a grocery list along with or the meal plan. (Converted from Langflow Store for AxieStudio compatibility)

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):
        prompt_template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node
        # and update the frontend_node with those values
        update_template_values(new_template=frontend_node, previous_template=current_frontend_node["template"])
        return frontend_node

    def _get_fallback_input(self, **kwargs):
        return DefaultPromptField(**kwargs)
code.name: code

template.name: template
template.value:
You are a meal planner app to help families make creative and nutritious meals that are personalsied for their requirements. The meal is  for a {age_in_months} month-old child. Some information that might be available are the following. Use the information where available, else ignore.

Child's favourite food {favourite_foods}. 
Typical diet {typical_diet} 
Allergies or dislikes include {allergies_dislikes}.
The family already has the following items available in their pantry which they would like to use  {pantry_items}

Create a flexible, creative meal plan for 1 week, offering breakfast, lunch/dinner, and snack options. The plan should inspire and support busy parents, emphasizing nutrition, variety, and simplicity, while keeping the meals enjoyable for the child. Provide the following as a json output 


1) Meal plan
Prioritize a mix of meal types with a total of 15 meals suggested and atleast the following. ensure the meals are balanced in micro and macro nutrition needs for child based on their age.
Draw 1-2 recipes from well regarded recipe sources for both kids and adults such as Cookie and Kate and Love and Lemons
2 - Meals that incorporate the child’s favorite foods wherever specified
2 meals differnt from the favourite foods, but that the child is likely to enjoy baed on their favourite foods.
2 exploratory meals to introduce the child to new flavors and textures
2 meals that introduce an age appropriate item that the child would be unlikely to have tried before
Use pantry items wherever specified, as a base for some meals, without being repititive.  Present them in realistic recipes that a talented home chef would make for a kid of that age
Ensure low to moderate complexity dishes, allowing for reasonable repetition to ease the burden on busy parents.
Group meals into breakfast, lunch/dinner, and snack options .This gives parents the freedom to sequence and rotate meals as they see fit.

2) Serving suggestions
Creative presentation: Suggest creative plating and serving ideas 


3) Recipes: Enter the recipes for the above dishes

4) Grocery list - Present the grocery list  to make the above meals  with quantities in Indian / SI units

node.description: Create a prompt template with dynamic variables.

anthropic_api_url.name: anthropic_api_url
anthropic_api_url.info: Endpoint of the Anthropic API. Defaults to 'https://api.anthropic.com' if not specified.

code.value:
from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FloatInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, SecretStrInput


class AnthropicModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "Anthropic"
    description = "Generate text using Anthropic Chat&Completion LLMs with prefill support."
    icon = "Anthropic"
    name = "AnthropicModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            value=4096,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model",
            display_name="Model Name",
            options=[
                "claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620",
                "claude-3-opus-20240229",
                "claude-3-sonnet-20240229",
                "claude-3-haiku-20240307",
            ],
            info="https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/chat/anthropic",
            value="claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="anthropic_api_key",
            display_name="Anthropic API Key",
            info="Your Anthropic API key.",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="anthropic_api_url",
            display_name="Anthropic API URL",
            advanced=True,
            info="Endpoint of the Anthropic API. Defaults to 'https://api.anthropic.com' if not specified.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="prefill",
            display_name="Prefill",
            info="Prefill text to guide the model's response.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        try:
            from langchain_anthropic.chat_models import ChatAnthropic
        except ImportError:
            raise ImportError(
                "langchain_anthropic is not installed. Please install it with `pip install langchain_anthropic`."
            )
        model = self.model
        anthropic_api_key = self.anthropic_api_key
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        temperature = self.temperature
        anthropic_api_url = self.anthropic_api_url or "https://api.anthropic.com"

        try:
            output = ChatAnthropic(
                model=model,
                anthropic_api_key=(SecretStr(anthropic_api_key) if anthropic_api_key else None),
                max_tokens_to_sample=max_tokens,  # type: ignore
                temperature=temperature,
                anthropic_api_url=anthropic_api_url,
                streaming=self.stream,
            )
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not connect to Anthropic API.") from e

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, exception: Exception) -> str | None:
        """
        Get a message from an Anthropic exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """
        try:
            from anthropic import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return None
        if isinstance(exception, BadRequestError):
            message = exception.body.get("error", {}).get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return None
code.name: code

max_tokens.name: max_tokens
max_tokens.info: The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.

prefill.name: prefill
prefill.info: Prefill text to guide the model's response.

stream.name: stream
stream.info: Stream the response from the model. Streaming works only in Chat.

system_message.name: system_message
system_message.info: System message to pass to the model.

code.value:
from axiestudio.base.io.text import TextComponent
from axiestudio.io import MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class TextInputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Input"
    description = "Get text inputs from the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextInput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as input.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        return message

from axiestudio.base.io.text import TextComponent
from axiestudio.io import MultilineInput, Output
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message


class TextOutputComponent(TextComponent):
    display_name = "Text Output"
    description = "Display a text output in the Playground."
    icon = "type"
    name = "TextOutput"

    inputs = [
        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as output.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        self.status = self.input_value
        return message

from axiestudio.base.prompts.api_utils import process_prompt_template
from axiestudio.custom import Component
from axiestudio.inputs.inputs import DefaultPromptField
from axiestudio.io import Output, PromptInput
from axiestudio.schema.message import Message
from axiestudio.template.utils import update_template_values


class PromptComponent(Component):
    display_name: str = "Prompt"
    description: str = "Create a prompt template with dynamic variables."
    icon = "prompts"
    trace_type = "prompt"
    name = "Prompt"

    inputs = [
        PromptInput(name="template", display_name="Template"),
    ]

    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Prompt Message", name="prompt", method="build_prompt"),
    ]

    async def build_prompt(
        self,
    ) -> Message:
        prompt = await Message.from_template_and_variables(**self._attributes)
        self.status = prompt.text
        return prompt

    def _update_template(self, frontend_node: dict):

        custom_fields = frontend_node["custom_fields"]
        frontend_node_template = frontend_node["template"]
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=prompt_template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=custom_fields,
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node_template,
        )
        return frontend_node

    def post_code_processing(self, new_frontend_node: dict, current_frontend_node: dict):
        """
        This function is called after the code validation is done.
        """
        frontend_node = super().post_code_processing(new_frontend_node, current_frontend_node)
        template = frontend_node["template"]["template"]["value"]
        # Kept it duplicated for backwards compatibility
        _ = process_prompt_template(
            template=template,
            name="template",
            custom_fields=frontend_node["custom_fields"],
            frontend_node_template=frontend_node["template"],
        )
        # Now that template is updated, we need to grab any values that were set in the current_frontend_node

You are a meal planner app to help families make creative and nutritious meals that are personalsied for their requirements. The meal is  for a {age_in_months} month-old child. Some information that might be available are the following. Use the information where available, else ignore.

Child's favourite food {favourite_foods}. 
Typical diet {typical_diet} 
Allergies or dislikes include {allergies_dislikes}.
The family already has the following items available in their pantry which they would like to use  {pantry_items}

Create a flexible, creative meal plan for 1 week, offering breakfast, lunch/dinner, and snack options. The plan should inspire and support busy parents, emphasizing nutrition, variety, and simplicity, while keeping the meals enjoyable for the child. Provide the following as a json output 


1) Meal plan
Prioritize a mix of meal types with a total of 15 meals suggested and atleast the following. ensure the meals are balanced in micro and macro nutrition needs for child based on their age.
Draw 1-2 recipes from well regarded recipe sources for both kids and adults such as Cookie and Kate and Love and Lemons
2 - Meals that incorporate the child’s favorite foods wherever specified
2 meals differnt from the favourite foods, but that the child is likely to enjoy baed on their favourite foods.
2 exploratory meals to introduce the child to new flavors and textures
2 meals that introduce an age appropriate item that the child would be unlikely to have tried before
Use pantry items wherever specified, as a base for some meals, without being repititive.  Present them in realistic recipes that a talented home chef would make for a kid of that age
Ensure low to moderate complexity dishes, allowing for reasonable repetition to ease the burden on busy parents.
Group meals into breakfast, lunch/dinner, and snack options .This gives parents the freedom to sequence and rotate meals as they see fit.

2) Serving suggestions
Creative presentation: Suggest creative plating and serving ideas 


3) Recipes: Enter the recipes for the above dishes

4) Grocery list - Present the grocery list  to make the above meals  with quantities in Indian / SI units

from pydantic.v1 import SecretStr

from axiestudio.base.models.model import LCModelComponent
from axiestudio.field_typing import LanguageModel
from axiestudio.io import DropdownInput, FloatInput, IntInput, MessageTextInput, SecretStrInput


class AnthropicModelComponent(LCModelComponent):
    display_name = "Anthropic"
    description = "Generate text using Anthropic Chat&Completion LLMs with prefill support."
    icon = "Anthropic"
    name = "AnthropicModel"

    inputs = LCModelComponent._base_inputs + [
        IntInput(
            name="max_tokens",
            display_name="Max Tokens",
            advanced=True,
            value=4096,
            info="The maximum number of tokens to generate. Set to 0 for unlimited tokens.",
        ),
        DropdownInput(
            name="model",
            display_name="Model Name",
            options=[
                "claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620",
                "claude-3-opus-20240229",
                "claude-3-sonnet-20240229",
                "claude-3-haiku-20240307",
            ],
            info="https://python.langchain.com/docs/integrations/chat/anthropic",
            value="claude-3-5-sonnet-20240620",
        ),
        SecretStrInput(
            name="anthropic_api_key",
            display_name="Anthropic API Key",
            info="Your Anthropic API key.",
        ),
        FloatInput(name="temperature", display_name="Temperature", value=0.1),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="anthropic_api_url",
            display_name="Anthropic API URL",
            advanced=True,
            info="Endpoint of the Anthropic API. Defaults to 'https://api.anthropic.com' if not specified.",
        ),
        MessageTextInput(
            name="prefill",
            display_name="Prefill",
            info="Prefill text to guide the model's response.",
            advanced=True,
        ),
    ]

    def build_model(self) -> LanguageModel:  # type: ignore[type-var]
        try:
            from langchain_anthropic.chat_models import ChatAnthropic
        except ImportError:
            raise ImportError(
                "langchain_anthropic is not installed. Please install it with `pip install langchain_anthropic`."
            )
        model = self.model
        anthropic_api_key = self.anthropic_api_key
        max_tokens = self.max_tokens
        temperature = self.temperature
        anthropic_api_url = self.anthropic_api_url or "https://api.anthropic.com"

        try:
            output = ChatAnthropic(
                model=model,
                anthropic_api_key=(SecretStr(anthropic_api_key) if anthropic_api_key else None),
                max_tokens_to_sample=max_tokens,  # type: ignore
                temperature=temperature,
                anthropic_api_url=anthropic_api_url,
                streaming=self.stream,
            )
        except Exception as e:
            raise ValueError("Could not connect to Anthropic API.") from e

        return output  # type: ignore

    def _get_exception_message(self, exception: Exception) -> str | None:
        """
        Get a message from an Anthropic exception.

        Args:
            exception (Exception): The exception to get the message from.

        Returns:
            str: The message from the exception.
        """
        try:
            from anthropic import BadRequestError
        except ImportError:
            return None
        if isinstance(exception, BadRequestError):
            message = exception.body.get("error", {}).get("message")  # type: ignore
            if message:
                return message
        return None

        MultilineInput(
            name="input_value",
            display_name="Text",
            info="Text to be passed as output.",
        ),
    ]
    outputs = [
        Output(display_name="Text", name="text", method="text_response"),
    ]

    def text_response(self) -> Message:
        message = Message(
            text=self.input_value,
        )
        self.status = self.input_value
        return message
code.name: code

input_value.name: input_value
input_value.info: Text to be passed as output.

node.description: Display a text output in the Playground.
